Amazon.co.uk Review

Lovely filming, Maggie Smith at her best, heartwarming story with some dark flashbacks, great scenery (Italy). Watch it on a rainy Sunday afternoon with a glass of wine. Timothy Spall surprised with a good Irish accent. Not what we had expected and we enjoyed it very much. A light touch from the director and the best from the cast.

Synopsis

Based on the novella by William Trevor, MY HOUSE IN UMBRIA is set in the sprawling Italian countryside. After a tragic train accident, four survivors find solace in the villa of an English writer, Mrs. Delahunty (Maggie Smith). The other survivors--an American girl (Emmy Clarke), a British general (Ronnie Barker), and a young German (Benno Furmann)--struggle to come to terms with the disaster, as an inspector (Giancarlo Giannini) tries to figure out exactly what happened. Eventually, the young girl&#039;s uncle (Chris Cooper) shows up, bringing the film to a climax.

Enjoy.
